descriptionProfile: National Geographic Photographer; Author; Keynote Speaker; Workshop Leader; Asia Specialist. Follow @thesilkroadjourney
National Geographic Photographer; Author; Keynote Speaker; Workshop Leader; Asia Specialist. Follow

posts.description: @better_moments_photography - Join Mike on a photographic exploration of the Silk Road: A Historical Legacy, in October, 2017. This 14 day photography workshop will explore one of the worlds' most famous trade routes in China. Details can be found in the link on @better_moments_photography. Deal-making here is still done the old-fashioned way, up close and personal: two traders bargain head-to-head over livestock at the Sunday market in Kashgar, China. Only a few spots left. Hope to see you there!  #silkroad #photographyworkshop #China #photography #workshop #Kashgar #Kashi #Xinjiang #market #bazaar #MarcoPolo @natgeo @natgeocreative @natgeotravel @supchinanews @thephotosociety @thesilkroadjourney @natgeo.media

Prescribed burn, Mendham, New Jersey:  As a volunteer fireman in a rural Jersey town, we set fires to prevent the buildup of combustible material when weather conditions are right.  #prescribedburn #controlledburn #Mendham #NewJersey #NJ #fireprevention @natgeo @natgeocreative @natgeotravel @thephotosociety

From the National Geographic Taiwan story on Mazu - The goddess of the sea, protector of sailors and fishermen, and most popular God in Taiwan - The 9th and final day of the Dajia Mazu Pilgrimage brings the soot covered palanquin of Mazu home to Dajia Jenn Lann (Mazu) Temple in Taichung, where it all began. Fireworks are the cause of the black, sooty mess. The yellow shirted fireworks crew clear the final path to the temple. This is one of the world's biggest religious celebrations, the pilgrimage lasts for 9 days as Mazu is transported around southern Taiwan to more than 100 temples. #Taichung #Taiwan #temple #Mazu @natgeo.media @natgeo @natgeocreative @natgeotravel @thephotosociety

Horses and yak graze near the shore of Namtso Lake, the largest in the Tibetan Autonomous Region and highest in the world at 15,479 ft. This natural, salt lake is sacred to the Tibetans and is accessible by road from Lhasa. I get to travel to some pretty amazing places but without organizations like @nature_org working hard to protect them, that just wouldn’t be possible. This upcoming Earth Day, let’s help @nature_org stand up for nature—and inspire others—by entering the Nature Conservancy’s “What’s Your Nature?” Photo Contest.  #lake #Namtso #lakenam #lakeNamtso #Tibet #Lhasa #China #photocontest #earthday @natgeo @natgeocreative @natgeotravel @supchinanews @thephotosociety @thesilkroadjourney @natgeo.media
Wind blows in blue skies over Beijing. #smogfree #forbiddencity #beijing #china @natgeo @natgeocreative @nature_org @thephotosociety

View from my window just before landing in Beijing. The fog in the mountains gives an indication of the smog that awaits me on the ground in the city. #beijing #China #smog @natgeo @natgeotravel @thephotosociety

It’s one of the world's biggest religious celebrations, the pilgrimage lasts for 9 days as Mazu is transported around southern Taiwan to more than 100 temples. #Taichung #Taiwan #temple #Mazu @natgeo.media @natgeo @natgeocreative @natgeotravel @thephotosociety

Morning traffic on an avenue in Ya'an in Sichuan province, a tea growing center, birth place of tea. Now it teems with cars instead of carts. #Yaan #Sichuan #China #travel #silkroad @thesilkroadjourney @natgeo @natgeocreative @natgeotravel @thephotosociety @supchinanews
